robovac_sensors.name: Robovac Sensors
robovac_sensors.description: Navigation and detection sensors - ensures proper movement and obstacle avoidance
robovac_sensors.notes: Clean regularly, replace when navigation issues occur

cleaning_tray.name: Cleaning Tray
cleaning_tray.description: Dust collection tray - holds debris during cleaning cycles
cleaning_tray.notes: Empty regularly, replace when cracked or damaged

side_brush.name: Side Brush
side_brush.description: Edge cleaning brush - sweeps debris into main brush path
side_brush.notes: Replace when bent or missing bristles

brush_guard.name: Brush Guard
brush_guard.description: Protective guard for rolling brush - prevents hair tangles

rolling_brush.name: Rolling Brush
rolling_brush.description: Main cleaning brush - primary debris collection mechanism
rolling_brush.notes: Replace when tangled or worn down

filter.name: Filter
filter.description: Air filtration system - captures fine dust and allergens
filter.notes: Replace when dirty or reduced suction

mopping_cloth.name: Mopping Cloth
mopping_cloth.description: Mopping attachment - for wet cleaning hard floors
mopping_cloth.notes: Replace when frayed or no longer absorbs water

water_tank_level.name: Water Tank Level
water_tank_level.description: Water tank level sensor - monitors remaining cleaning water
water_tank_level.notes: TESTING: Try different byte positions - currently shows 35% but should be 100%

user_notes: === EUFY ROBOVAC ACCESSORY CONFIGURATION ===
üìù EDITING INSTRUCTIONS:
‚Ä¢ Update 'current_life_remaining' percentages as accessories wear down
‚Ä¢ Update 'hours_remaining' to match current usage
‚Ä¢ Set 'enabled': false to disable tracking for specific accessories
‚Ä¢ Adjust 'replacement_threshold' to change when low-life alerts trigger
‚Ä¢ Add notes about replacement dates or maintenance performed
üîÑ AFTER EDITING:
‚Ä¢ Restart the Home Assistant integration to load new values
‚Ä¢ Check the debug logs for accessory change detection
‚Ä¢ Monitor sensor entities for updated values
üéØ USAGE TRACKING WORKFLOW:
1. Before cleaning: Record current percentages
2. Run cleaning cycle
3. After docking: Update percentages based on usage
4. Restart integration to capture new baseline
5. Compare logs to find sensor byte changes
üìä ANALYSIS TIPS:
‚Ä¢ Look for byte changes at the specified positions (37, 75, 95, 125, 146, 228, 5)
‚Ä¢ Compare 'before' and 'after' base64 decoded values
‚Ä¢ Focus on bytes that decrease by 1-3% after cleaning cycles
‚Ä¢ Save logs for AI analysis or Python comparison tools
‚ö†Ô∏è  REPLACEMENT THRESHOLDS:
‚Ä¢ Robovac Sensors: Replace at 10% (critical for navigation)
‚Ä¢ Cleaning Tray: Replace at 15% (affects dust collection)
‚Ä¢ Side Brush: Replace at 15% (impacts edge cleaning)
‚Ä¢ Brush Guard: Replace at 10% (protects main brush)
‚Ä¢ Rolling Brush: Replace at 10% (primary cleaning component)
‚Ä¢ Filter: Replace at 20% (affects air quality and suction)
‚Ä¢ Mopping Cloth: Replace at 30% (absorbs less water when worn)
üîß EXAMPLE UPDATE:
After 10 hours of cleaning, update:
'current_life_remaining': 97 (was 99)
'hours_remaining': 348 (was 358)
üí° PRO TIPS:
‚Ä¢ Keep a maintenance log in the 'notes' field
‚Ä¢ Use realistic wear rates based on actual cleaning frequency
‚Ä¢ Set calendar reminders based on 'hours_remaining'
‚Ä¢ Compare multiple cleaning sessions to confirm sensor locations
